abstract: Fate of Iranian nuclear deal is still unclear even though Sens Harry Reid and Debbie Stabenow have offered their endorsement, bringing supporters of deal close to gaining enough votes in Senate; those hoping to see deal approved is worry over possibility that Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell will allow politically charged amendments to be added to resolution disapproving of deal, making it more politically fraught and increasing difficulty of ultimately approving accord.
lead_paragraph: The party’s leaders are still lobbying the undecided lawmakers, but are worried that Republicans might try to add politically charged amendments to the deal.

headline.main: Wild Cards Remain as Democrats Add Supporters on Iran Deal
headline.print_headline: Wild Cards Remain as Democrats Add Votes on Iran Deal

snippet: The party’s leaders are still lobbying the undecided lawmakers, but are worried that Republicans might try to add politically charged amendments to the deal.
